verses.verse: Then the Lord<WH3068> said<WH6030> <WH559> to Job,<WH347>
"Will the faultfinder<WH3250> contend<WH7378> with the Almighty<WH7706>? Let him who reproves<WH3198> God<WH433> answer<WH6030> it."
Then Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> the Lord<WH3068> and said,<WH559>
"Behold,<WH2005> I am insignificant;<WH7043> what<WH4100> can I reply<WH7725> to Thee? I lay<WH7760> my hand<WH3027> on my mouth.<WH6310>
"Once<WH259> I have spoken,<WH1696> and I will not answer;<WH6030> Even twice,<WH8147> and I will add<WH3254> no<WH3808> more."
Then the Lord<WH3068> answered<WH6030> Job<WH347> out of the storm,<WH9370> and said,<WH559>
"Now<WH4994> gird<WH247> up your loins<WH2504> like a man;<WH1397> I will ask<WH7592> you, and you instruct<WH3045> Me.
"Will you really<WH637> annul<WH6565> My judgment<WH4941>? Will you condemn<WH7561> Me that you may be justified<WH6663>?
"Or<WH518> do you have an arm<WH2220> like God,<WH410> And can you thunder<WH7481> with a voice<WH6963> like<WH3644> His?
"Adorn<WH5710> yourself<WH5710> with eminence<WH1347> and dignity;<WH1363> And clothe<WH3847> yourself<WH3847> with honor<WH1935> and majesty.<WH1926>
"Pour<WH6327> out the overflowings<WH5678> of your anger;<WH639> And look<WH7200> on everyone<WH3605> who<WH1343> is proud,<WH1343> and make<WH8213> him low.<WH8213>
"Look<WH7200> on everyone<WH3605> who<WH1343> is proud,<WH1343> [and] humble<WH3665> him; And tread<WH1915> down<WH1915> the wicked<WH7563> where<WH8478> they stand.<WH8478>
"Hide<WH2934> them in the dust<WH6083> together;<WH3162> Bind<WH2280> them in the hidden<WH2934> [place.]
"Then I will also<WH1571> confess<WH3034> to you, That your own right<WH3225> hand<WH3225> can save<WH3467> you.
"Behold<WH2009> now,<WH4994> Behemoth,<WH930> which<WH834> I made<WH6213> as well<WH5973> as you; He eats<WH398> grass<WH2682> like an ox.<WH1241>
"Behold<WH2009> now,<WH4994> his strength<WH3581> in his loins,<WH4975> And his power<WH202> in the muscles<WH8306> of his belly.<WH990>
"He bends<WH9156> his tail<WH2180> like<WH3644> a cedar;<WH730> The sinews<WH1517> of his thighs<WH6344> are knit<WH8276> together.<WH8276>
"His bones<WH6106> are tubes<WH650> of bronze;<WH5154> His limbs<WH1634> are like bars<WH4300> of iron.<WH1270>
"He is the first<WH7225> of the ways<WH1870> of God;<WH410> Let his maker<WH6213> bring<WH5066> near<WH5066> his sword.<WH2719>
"Surely<WH5608> the mountains<WH2022> bring<WH5375> him food,<WH944> And all<WH3605> the beasts<WH9130> of the field<WH7704> play<WH7832> there.<WH8033>
"Under<WH8478> the lotus<WH6628> plants<WH6628> he lies<WH7901> down,<WH7901> In the covert<WH5643> of the reeds<WH7070> and the marsh.<WH1207>
"The lotus<WH6628> plants<WH6628> cover<WH5526> him with shade;<WH6738> The willows<WH6155> of the brook<WH5158> surround<WH5437> him.
"If<WH2005> a river<WH5104> rages,<WH6231> he is not alarmed;<WH2648> He is confident,<WH982> though<WH3588> the Jordan<WH3383> rushes<WH1518> to his mouth.<WH6310>
"Can anyone capture<WH3947> him when he is on watch,<WH5869> With barbs<WH4170> can anyone pierce<WH9344> [his] nose<WH639>?
